verses.verse: Moreover I-yov <WH347> continued <WH3254> <WH8686> <WH5375> <WH8800> his parable <WH4912>, and said <WH559> <WH8799>,
Oh that <WH5414> <WH8799> I were as in months <WH3391> past <WH6924>, as in the days <WH3117> when 'Elohim <WH433> preserved <WH8104> <WH8799> me;
When his candle <WH5216> shined <WH1984> <WH8800> upon my head <WH7218>, and when by his light <WH216> I walked <WH3212> <WH8799> through darkness <WH2822>;
As I was in the days <WH3117> of my youth <WH2779>, when the secret <WH5475> of 'Elohim <WH433> was upon my tabernacle <WH168>;
When 'El SHaddai <WH7706> was yet with me, when my children <WH5288> were about <WH5439> me;
When I washed <WH7364> <WH8800> my steps <WH1978> with butter <WH2529>, and the rock <WH6697> poured me out <WH6694> <WH8799> rivers <WH6388> of oil <WH8081>;
When I went out <WH3318> <WH8800> to the gate <WH8179> through the city <WH7176>, when I prepared <WH3559> <WH8686> my seat <WH4186> in the street <WH7339> !
The young men <WH5288> saw <WH7200> <WH8804> me, and hid <WH2244> <WH8738> themselves: and the aged <WH3453> arose <WH6965> <WH8804>, and stood up <WH5975> <WH8804>.
The princes <WH8269> refrained <WH6113> <WH8804> talking <WH4405>, and laid <WH7760> <WH8799> their hand <WH3709> on their mouth <WH6310>.
The nobles <WH5057> held <WH2244> <WH8738> their peace <WH6963>, and their tongue <WH3956> cleaved <WH1692> <WH8804> to the roof of their mouth <WH2441>.
When the ear <WH241> heard <WH8085> <WH8804> me, then it blessed <WH833> <WH8762> me; and when the eye <WH5869> saw <WH7200> <WH8804> me, it gave witness <WH5749> <WH8686> to me:
Because I delivered <WH4422> <WH8762> the poor <WH6041> that cried <WH7768> <WH8764>, and the fatherless <WH3490>, and him that had none to help <WH5826> <WH8802> him.
The b'rakhah <WH1293> of him that was ready to perish <WH6> <WH8802> came <WH935> <WH8799> upon me: and I caused the widow's <WH490> heart <WH3820> to sing for joy <WH7442> <WH8686>.
I put <WH3847> <WH8804> on righteousness <WH6664>, and it clothed <WH3847> <WH8799> me: my judgment <WH4941> was as a robe <WH4598> and a diadem <WH6797>.
I was eyes <WH5869> to the blind <WH5787>, and feet <WH7272> was I to the lame <WH6455>.
I was a father <WH1> to the poor <WH34>: and the cause <WH7379> which I knew <WH3045> <WH8804> not I searched out <WH2713> <WH8799>.
And I brake <WH7665> <WH8762> the jaws <WH4973> of the wicked <WH5767>, and plucked <WH7993> <WH8686> the spoil <WH2964> out of his teeth <WH8127>.
Then I said <WH559> <WH8799>, I shall die <WH1478> <WH8799> in my nest <WH7064>, and I shall multiply <WH7235> <WH8686> my days <WH3117> as the sand <WH2344>.
My root <WH8328> was spread out <WH6605> <WH8803> by the waters <WH4325>, and the dew <WH2919> lay all night <WH3885> <WH8799> upon my branch <WH7105>.
My glory <WH3519> was fresh <WH2319> in me <WH5978>, and my bow <WH7198> was renewed <WH2498> <WH8686> in my hand <WH3027>.
Unto me men gave ear <WH8085> <WH8804>, and waited <WH3176> <WH8765>, and kept silence <WH1826> <WH8799> at <WH3926> my counsel <WH6098>.
After <WH310> my words <WH1697> they spake not again <WH8138> <WH8799>; and my speech <WH4405> dropped <WH5197> <WH8799> upon them.
And they waited <WH3176> <WH8765> for me as for the rain <WH4306>; and they opened <WH6473> <WH8804> their mouth <WH6310> wide as for the latter rain <WH4456>.
If I laughed <WH7832> <WH8799> on them, they believed <WH539> <WH8686> it not; and the light <WH216> of my countenance <WH6440> they cast not down <WH5307> <WH8686>.

I chose <WH977> <WH8799> out their way <WH1870>, and sat <WH3427> <WH8799> chief <WH7218>, and dwelt <WH7931> <WH8799> as a king <WH4428> in the army <WH1416>, as one that comforteth <WH5162> <WH8762> the mourners <WH57>.
